org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.ieee1609dot2.generator

Class SecuredDataGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.ieee1609dot2.generator.SecuredDataGenerator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ETSISecuredDataGenerator, SecuredCrlGenerator

    public class SecuredDataGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Base CertGenerator class containing common methods.

      • SecuredDataGenerator

        public SecuredDataGenerator(int version,
                            Ieee1609Dot2CryptoManager cryptoManager,
                            HashAlgorithm hashAlgorithm,
                            Signature.SignatureChoices signAlgorithm)
                     throws java.security.SignatureException
        Main constructor.
        Parameters:
        version - version if Ieee1609Dot2Data to generate.
        cryptoManager - the related crypto manager
        hashAlgorithm - the related hash algorithm used in messages
        signAlgorithm - the related sign algorithm used in messages.
        Throws:
        java.security.SignatureException - if internal problems occurred initializing the generator.

    • Method Detail

      • genSignedData

        public Ieee1609Dot2Data genSignedData(HeaderInfo hi,
                                      byte[] message,
                                      SecuredDataGenerator.SignerIdentifierType signerIdentifierType,
                                      Certificate[] signerCertificateChain,
                                      java.security.PrivateKey signerPrivateKey)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.security.SignatureException,
                                      java.io.IOException
        Method to generate a Signed Ieee1609Dot2Data.
        Parameters:
        hi - the header information data to include.
        message - the message data to sign.
        signerIdentifierType - type of signer identifier to include, one of SignerIdentifierType
        signerCertificateChain - the complete chain up to the trust anchor. Important the trust anchor MUST be an explicit certificate and the array must be in the order of end entity certificate at position 0 and trust anchor last in array.
        signerPrivateKey - private key of signer.
        Returns:
        a signed Ieee1609Dot2Data structure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fault was discovered in supplied parameters.
        java.security.SignatureException - if internal problems occurred generating the signature.
        java.io.IOException - if IO exception occurred communicating with underlying systems.

      • verifySignedData

        public boolean verifySignedData(Ieee1609Dot2Data signedData,
                                java.util.Map<HashedId8,Certificate> certStore,
                                java.util.Map<HashedId8,Certificate> trustStore)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.security.SignatureException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Method to verify a signed data, method only verifies the signature, it doesn't validate it by permissions, validity or geographically.
        Parameters:
        signedData - the signed data to verify.
        certStore - a list of known certificates that can be used to build a certificate path (excluding trust anchors).
        trustStore - certificates in trust store, must be explicit certificate in order to qualify as trust anchors.
        Returns:
        true if data structure signature verifies.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fault was discovered in supplied parameters.
        java.security.SignatureException - if internal problems occurred verifying the signature.
        java.io.IOException - if IO exception occurred communicating with underlying systems.

                                java.security.PublicKey signerPublicKey)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.security.SignatureException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Method to verify a signed data against a specific public key. The method only verifies the signature, it doesn't validate it by permissions, validity or geographically.
        Parameters:
        signedData - the signed data to verify.
        signerPublicKey - the public key of the signer.
        Returns:
        true if data structure signature verifies.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fault was discovered in supplied parameters.
        java.security.SignatureException - if internal problems occurred verifying the signature.
        java.io.IOException - if IO exception occurred communicating with underlying systems.

      • encryptData

        public EncryptResult encryptData(AlgorithmIndicator alg,
                                 byte[] data,
                                 Recipient[] recipients)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.security.GeneralSecurityException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Method to encrypt data to a list of receipients.
        Parameters:
        alg - algorithm indicating which symmetric and depending on encryption method which asymmetric algorithm to use.
        data - the data to encrypt
        recipients - a list of recipients, all recipients should be a Recipient implementation and be of the same type.
        Returns:
        an encrypted Ieee1609Dot2Data structure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the argument was invalid.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if internal problems occurred encrypting the data.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred when encrypting the data.

                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                              java.security.GeneralSecurityException,

        encryptedData - the data to decrypt.
        recieverStore - the store of known receiver keys.
        Returns:

      • signAndEncryptData

        public EncryptResult signAndEncryptData(HeaderInfo hi,
                                        byte[] message,
                                        SecuredDataGenerator.SignerIdentifierType signerIdentifierType,
                                        Certificate[] signerCertificateChain,
                                        java.security.PrivateKey signerPrivateKey,
                                        AlgorithmIndicator encAlg,
                                        Recipient[] recipients)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                        java.security.SignatureException,
                                        java.security.GeneralSecurityException,
                                        java.io.IOException
        Method to sign and then encrypt a Ieee1609Dot2Data structure.
        Parameters:
        hi - the header information data to include.
        message - the data to sign and encrypt
        signerIdentifierType - signerIdentifierType type of signer identifier to include, one of SignerIdentifierType
        signerCertificateChain - the complete chain up to the trust anchor. Important the trust anchor MUST be an explicit certificate and the array must be in the order of end entity certificate at position 0 and trust anchor last in array.
        signerPrivateKey - private key of signer.
        encAlg - algorithm indicating which symmetric and depending on encryption method which asymmetric algorithm to use.
        recipients - a list of recipients, all receiptients should be a Recipient implementation and be of the same type.
        Returns:
        a signed and then encrypted Ieee1609Dot2Data structure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fault was discovered in supplied parameters.
        java.security.SignatureException - if internal problems occurred generating the signature.
        java.io.IOException - if IO exception occurred communicating with underlying systems.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if internal problems occurred encrypting the data.

        signerPrivateKey - private key of signer.

      • decryptAndVerifySignedData

        public DecryptAndVerifyResult decryptAndVerifySignedData(byte[] message,
                                                         java.util.Map<HashedId8,Certificate> certStore,
                                                         java.util.Map<HashedId8,Certificate> trustStore,
                                                         java.util.Map<HashedId8,Receiver> recieverStore,
                                                         boolean requiredSignature,
                                                         boolean requireEncryption)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                         java.security.GeneralSecurityException,
                                                         java.io.IOException
        Method to decrypt and verify a signed data structure, the method returns the SignedData object containing a unsecured payload. This method only verifies the signature and does not check other header info parameters.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to decrypt and verify.
        certStore - a list of known certificates that can be used to build a certificate path (excluding trust anchors).
        trustStore - certificates in trust store, must be explicit certificate in order to qualify as trust anchors.
        recieverStore - the store of known receiver keys.
        requiredSignature - if it should be required that messages are signed.
        requireEncryption - if it should be required that message are encrypted.
        Returns:
        the decrypted data payload in the innermost unsecured data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fault was discovered in supplied parameters.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if internal problems occurred decrypting and verying the message.
        java.io.IOException - if IO exception occurred communicating with underlying systems.

      • decryptAndVerifySelfSignedData

        public DecryptAndVerifyResult decryptAndVerifySelfSignedData(byte[] message,
                                                             java.security.PublicKey signerPublicKey,
                                                             java.util.Map<HashedId8,Receiver> recieverStore,
                                                             boolean requiredSignature,
                                                             boolean requireEncryption)
                                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                             java.security.GeneralSecurityException,
                                                             java.io.IOException
        Method to decrypt and verify a self signed signed data structure, the method returns the SignedData object containing a unsecured payload. This method only verifies the signature and does not check other header info parameters.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to decrypt and verify.
        signerPublicKey - the signers public key used to verify the signature.
        recieverStore - the store of known receiver keys.
        requiredSignature - if it should be required that messages are signed.
        requireEncryption - if it should be required that message are encrypted.
        Returns:
        the decrypted data payload in the innermost unsecured data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fault was discovered in supplied parameters.
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - if internal problems occurred decrypting and verying the message.
        java.io.IOException - if IO exception occurred communicating with underlying systems.

      • newEncryptedDataStructure

        protected Ieee1609Dot2Data newEncryptedDataStructure(byte[] encodedData)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:

      • genHeaderInfo

        public HeaderInfo genHeaderInfo(long psid,
                                java.util.Date generationTime,
                                java.util.Date expiryTime,
                                ThreeDLocation generationLocation,
                                byte[] p2pcdLearningRequest,
                                byte[] cracaid,
                                java.lang.Integer crlSeries,
                                BasePublicEncryptionKey.BasePublicEncryptionKeyChoices encType,
                                java.security.PublicKey encryptionKey,
                                SequenceOfHashedId3 inlineP2pcdRequest,
                                Certificate requestedCertificate)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Help method to generate a SecuredData Header Info without the need to build all required data structures.
        Parameters:
        psid - the psid to set Required.
        generationTime - the generation time as Date, Optional.
        expiryTime - the exprity time as Date, Optional
        generationLocation - the generation location.
        p2pcdLearningRequest - the p2pcdLearningRequest 3 bytes, Optional
        cracaid - the cracaid usid in missing crl identifier, if set must also crlSeries be set, otherwise null
        crlSeries - the crl series used in missing crl identifier, Optional.
        encType - the type of encryption used. if set must also encryption key be set, Optional
        encryptionKey - the encryption key to set.
        inlineP2pcdRequest - if present, is used by the SDS to request unknown certificates per the inline peer-to-peer certificate distribution mechanism is given in Clause 8. This field shall only be present if p2pcdLearningRequest is not present. The HashedId3 is calculated with the whole certificate hash algorithm, determined as described in 6.4.3.
        requestedCertificate - if present, is used by the SDS to provide certificates per the “inline” version of the peer-to-peer certificate distribution mechanism.
        Returns:
        a generated header info structure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments where invalid.
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - if public key conversion failed.
